intro: Stenophragma glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular stenophragma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural research.
